intro: Gamosepalum lepidotostellatum, commonly known as the velvet-fruited star-flower, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a compact, shrub-like growth habit with hairy, glandular leaves that give it a distinctive velvety appearance. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Gamosepalum lepidotostellatum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rocky slopes and forest understories.
